definition: the property of an artificial intelligence system whereby its learned objectives and behavioral tendencies during deployment correspond to the goals specified during its training phase, ensuring that optimized models pursue their intended purposes rather than developing misaligned proxy objectives

positive_examples: This is an example of inner alignment.
The inner alignment demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed inner alignment in this context.
A typical case of inner alignment would involve these features.
The concept of inner alignment applies here.
The process of ensuring that an AI system's learned optimization process pursues the intended training objective.
negative_examples: This is an example of non deceptive alignment, not inner alignment.
This represents a i alignment process in general.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: NonDeceptiveAlignment, or other types of AIAlignmentProcess
